p: A UK survey of HIV has revealed an increase in new cases of HCV in MSM from 6.86 cases/1000 person-years in 2002 to 11.58 in 2006, almost double, with no apparent change in testing policy. Recently, there has been a change in current HCV infection, with an increased incidence in MSM than in PWID [ 39]. This trend was confirmed in the analysis of the Swiss study outlining an increase of 18 times the incidence of new cases in MSM from 0.23 (95% CI: 0.08 to 0.54) per 100 person-years in 1998 to 4.09 (95% CI: 2.57 to 6.18) in 2011 [ 40].
